item.title: Making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 550.

item.title: To prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the United States, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 551.

item.title: Highway and Transportation Funding Act of 2014

item.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 220 - 205 (Roll no. 472). (text: CR H7133)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 220 - 205 (Roll no. 472).(text: CR H7133)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 226 - 198 (Roll no. 471).
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H7152-7153)

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 696, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 696 and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Polis demanded yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on ordering the previous question on H.Res. 696 until later in the legislative day. (consideration: CR H7149)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 696.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H7133-7149)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 132.

The rule makes in order one hour of debate each for H.R. 5230 and H.R. 5272. The rule also makes in order for one hour debate on a motion that the House disagree to the Senate amendment to H.R. 5021. Any motion pursuant to clause 4 of rule XXII relating to H.R. 5021 may be offered only by the Majority Leader or his designee. It shall be in order at any time on the legislative day of July 31, 2014 for the Speaker to entertain motions to suspend the rules.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-567, by Mr. Cole.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 113-567, by Mr. Cole.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5230) making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5272) to prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the United States, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 5021) to provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund, and for other purposes.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5230) making supplemental appropriations for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2014, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5272) to prohibit certain actions with respect to deferred action for aliens not lawfully present in the United States, and for other purposes; providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 5021) to provide an extension of Federal-aid highway, highway safety, motor carrier safety, transit, and other programs funded out of the Highway Trust Fund, and for other purposes; and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
